definition: worldly wisdom/the ways of the world/to know how to get on in the world
to do sb a favor at little cost
to do a favor to sb
erhua variant of 人情味[ren2 qing2 wei4]

sentences.english: I was in my parents' debt.
sentences.chinese: 我欠下了我父母的人情債。

sentences.english: Eat a feast with three king size bowls and give only ten cents?
sentences.chinese: 三個海碗的席喫着，就出一毛錢的人情？

sentences.english: I'm only paying back on old debt of thankfulness.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我只是在償還這份舊時的人情債。

sentences.english: Because before Wang Lan owes the white dragon favor, she promised to come down.
sentences.chinese: 因爲之前汪蘭欠着白龍人情，她只好答應下來。

sentences.english: Aside from the bargains, flea markets always have a great atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 除了撿便宜，逛跳蚤市場最有趣的是感受人情味。

sentences.english: We should show empathy when we deal with problems.
sentences.chinese: 我們處理問題也要有些人情味兒。

sentences.english: exemplify, as a body, the professional and humane behavior of its members;
sentences.chinese: 作爲主體，例證其成員專業且有人情味的行爲。

sentences.english: I don't mind doing you a favour that costs me nothing.
That article things clarity all learning.
sentences.chinese: 世事洞明皆學問，人情練達即文章。

sentences.english: It was mean of you not to let the children play in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 你不通人情，不讓孩子們在雪地裏玩。

sentences.english: She’s learning the world person by person and place by place.
sentences.chinese: 她在瞭解世界各地的風土人情。

sentences.english: Lile says that he favors carry on peace pipe.
I owed him some favors, so I did so of my own accord.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一些人情，因此我心甘情願這樣做。

sentences.english: The world with eyes, human heart.
I owe a debt of gratitude to you.
sentences.chinese: 對你所做的事，我欠你壹份人情債。

definition: worldly wisdom/the ways of the world/to know how to get on in the world
lit. proper behavior is based on reciprocity (idiom)/fig. to return politeness for politeness
feelings and sensibilities/sentiment and face/sensitivity to other's feelings
to do sb a favor at little cost
spirit of loyalty and self-sacrifice/code of brotherhood/also pr. [yi4 qi5]
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
